heading: Soar Gorilla Spiritborn Endgame Build Guide
content: This build guide is currently archived, meaning it's not maintained for the current season. You may still use it and adapt it to your liking! Welcome to the Soar Gorilla Spiritborn Endgame Guide. This build flies through content at breakneck speeds. While most Spiritborn builds have good mobility, this one specializes in it above the rest. It deals damage almost exclusively by spamming . If you have enough cooldown reduction to bring its cooldown under 5 seconds you can cast it nonstop. Now I know what you are thinking, "Bob, how can this be a Soar build without ?" Let me tell you. Scorn of the Earth turns Soar into your , but Evade cooldown reducing effects, such as , don't impact Soar or Evade when you are wearing these boots. How crazy is that? If this changes I'll look at the build again. Until then this is the go to The key aspects that enable this build are: The idea is that you cast recalling the . Each feather reduces the cooldown of by .5 seconds. 10 feathers reduce the cooldown by 5 seconds. Season 6 is the . It features the faction which hunts Realmwalkers, massive behemoths that roam outdoor zones and beckon Mephisto's hellspawn. Participate in these zone events and take down the Realmwalkers to spawn a portal to a Seething Realm. There you can acquire Seething Opals, new consumables that stack with Elixirs for a XP buff and the chance to gather extra rewards when defeating enemies. The types of Opals are: Use these Opals at all times to earn reputation with the faction and unlock further rewards. for every attack to help negate provides you with easy access to more critical strike chance. Use the slider to see progression steps. At around Paragon 200, leveling slows down significantly and all important nodes and Glyph sockets should be unlocked. Afterwards, you can min/max your build with minor tweaks and by picking up additional smaller nodes. Some Glyph position swaps, board changes and other pathing adjustments may occur as you unlock your full potential. The setup displayed by default is the final version of the build before spending additional points that do not significantly impact your character's power. You can have up to two Runewords in your setup, each consisting of one Rune. Socket them in Two-Handed Weapons if your build calls for them, otherwise place them into your Armor pieces to replace normal gems. The Soar Gorilla Spiritborn focuses on the following combos: As long as you haven't unlocked the final setup or found the top runes, you can also benefit from these options: are unlocked during the Vessel of Hatred campaign and assist you in battle. There are 4 separate Mercenaries to choose from, each with their own skill trees and abilities. You can have one (permanent) mercenary during solo play and a who assists you from time to time in certain situations. She provides you with movement speed for , increased attack speed with , and another source of healing ( ) to help with for extra damage reduction, and slowing enemies which happens when you cast in order to stop them from running away. To enable the SoarGorilla  Spiritborn to perform optimally, hunt for these stats on your gear with good rolls and aim to them accordingly. Keep in mind that certain stats, such as Armor, Resistances, Extra Size Tempers, Attack Speed and more, have caps that may affect your priorities according to the items and Paragon points available at that moment. to check the suggested consumables. Before you dive into the Endgame with the Soar Gorilla Spiritborn, take a look at this overview of the items used in the build. See below for further details about the different progression steps and variants. Some of your Skill Tree choices depend on what items are available to you. Keep in mind that while we can guarantee that everyone has access to the same Aspects, the exact progression is different for everyone. This section is designed to guide your Soar Gorilla Spiritborn from a fresh level 60 into the very late endgame using the three variants . At the final step, you should be fully decked out with a great all-rounder build. From there, follow the other min/max variants if you want to optimize around certain activities such as If you are fresh in Torment 1 coming from a leveling guide, you will need to acquire MIDNIGHT before starting this build. Since only some Aspects can be guaranteed from Dungeon unlocks for the , focus on acquiring the additional aspects via gambling with The goal here is to progress through the Torment difficulties as you unlock Ancestrals, Paragon points, all and the most important to pilot this build. Some are used temporarily to fill slots that may be replaced with more items later on. This is the final version of the build's progression, including all regular , leaving you with a great all-rounder build for all content in the game. Additional variants use this as a baseline to optimize around certain activities. This Speedfarming variant optimizes the build for easy activities like Tiers after you have finished the variant and reached a plateau in your progression. This setup optimizes the build to push the highest possible Tiers in after you have finished the variant and reached a plateau in your progression. Once a guide is released, many players have questions on why and how we are approaching certain choices. In this section you can find the answers to the questions that have been asked the most. Your damage comes from each . You need to make sure each hits the boss by standing as close as possible to them. doesn't move you from your current location the animation is much faster. This is much easier for mouse and keyboard as you can hover over you character when you cast The build works really well when you decimate everything in seconds, but may get overwhelmed if fights are long against high level monsters. There are several adjustments you can make when you have trouble with more difficult content: Soar Gorilla Spiritborn have multiple ways to trigger up 100% of the time gives you Generally hardcore and softcore share the same builds. Outside of being more prudent in your gameplay, you can also tweak the setup slightly to raise your survivability: When you cast in an area around you, and then which triggers the second part of recalling all the feathers to you. Each feather deals damage to every enemy it passes through. You must make sure each feather hits the boss in order to do as much damage as possible. Each feather you pick up reduces the cooldown of by .5 seconds thanks to . If the cooldown of is under 5 seconds you can cast it repeatedly. doesn't move you from your current location the animation is much faster. Read up more on Attack Speed in our Bosses are immune to Crowd Control (CC) effects and instead take Stagger Damage when hit by one. The amount of stagger damage dealt depends on the type of CC and is proportional to its duration. After being hit by a CC effect, the Boss will temporarily take less Stagger Damage from a CC of the same type. Effectively, this means that when you're just spamming one type of CC you don't need to spam any more of it than what you need to keep a normal enemy permanently CC-d. To stagger the Boss quickly you need to use as many different types of CC as possible. After the Boss is staggered it gains a certain amount of stacking Stagger Damage Reduction for the rest of the fight: Bosses naturally regain 1% of their Stagger HP every second and when that regen is combined with 90% Stagger Damage Reduction it becomes borderline impossible to Stagger the Boss again unless you bring a serious amount of crowd controls. Soar Gorilla Spiritborn is a fun build great for speed farming, and carrying nightmare dungeons. The build is played as melee because pulls feathers in dealing maximum damage to the enemy closest to the caster. With a lot of mobility from , and has good area of effect clear with pulling enemies in. Go now, and slaughter... the demonic horde. Reviewed by

Outside of being more prudent in your gameplay, you can also tweak the setup slightly to raise your survivability: When you cast in an area around you, and then which triggers the second part of recalling all the feathers to you. Each feather deals damage to every enemy it passes through. You must make sure each feather hits the boss in order to do as much damage as possible. Each feather you pick up reduces the cooldown of by .5 seconds thanks to . If the cooldown of is under 5 seconds you can cast it repeatedly. doesn't move you from your current location the animation is much faster. Read up more on Attack Speed in our Bosses are immune to Crowd Control (CC) effects and instead take Stagger Damage when hit by one. The amount of stagger damage dealt depends on the type of CC and is proportional to its duration. After being hit by a CC effect, the Boss will temporarily take less Stagger Damage from a CC of the same type. Effectively, this means that when you're just spamming one type of CC you don't need to spam any more of it than what you need to keep a normal enemy permanently CC-d. To stagger the Boss quickly you need to use as many different types of CC as possible. After the Boss is staggered it gains a certain amount of stacking Stagger Damage Reduction for the rest of the fight: Bosses naturally regain 1% of their Stagger HP every second and when that regen is combined with 90% Stagger Damage Reduction it becomes borderline impossible to Stagger the Boss again unless you bring a serious amount of crowd controls. Soar Gorilla Spiritborn is a fun build great for speed farming, and carrying nightmare dungeons. The build is played as melee because pulls feathers in dealing maximum damage to the enemy closest to the caster. With a lot of mobility from , and has good area of effect clear with pulling enemies in. Go now, and slaughter... the demonic horde. Reviewed by

Outside of being more prudent in your gameplay, you can also tweak the setup slightly to raise your survivability: When you cast in an area around you, and then which triggers the second part of recalling all the feathers to you. Each feather deals damage to every enemy it passes through. You must make sure each feather hits the boss in order to do as much damage as possible. Each feather you pick up reduces the cooldown of by .5 seconds thanks to . If the cooldown of is under 5 seconds you can cast it repeatedly. doesn't move you from your current location the animation is much faster. Read up more on Attack Speed in our Bosses are immune to Crowd Control (CC) effects and instead take Stagger Damage when hit by one. The amount of stagger damage dealt depends on the type of CC and is proportional to its duration. After being hit by a CC effect, the Boss will temporarily take less Stagger Damage from a CC of the same type. Effectively, this means that when you're just spamming one type of CC you don't need to spam any more of it than what you need to keep a normal enemy permanently CC-d. To stagger the Boss quickly you need to use as many different types of CC as possible. After the Boss is staggered it gains a certain amount of stacking Stagger Damage Reduction for the rest of the fight: Bosses naturally regain 1% of their Stagger HP every second and when that regen is combined with 90% Stagger Damage Reduction it becomes borderline impossible to Stagger the Boss again unless you bring a serious amount of crowd controls. Soar Gorilla Spiritborn is a fun build great for speed farming, and carrying nightmare dungeons. The build is played as melee because pulls feathers in dealing maximum damage to the enemy closest to the caster. With a lot of mobility from , and has good area of effect clear with pulling enemies in. Go now, and slaughter... the demonic horde. Reviewed by

After the Boss is staggered it gains a certain amount of stacking Stagger Damage Reduction for the rest of the fight: Bosses naturally regain 1% of their Stagger HP every second and when that regen is combined with 90% Stagger Damage Reduction it becomes borderline impossible to Stagger the Boss again unless you bring a serious amount of crowd controls. Soar Gorilla Spiritborn is a fun build great for speed farming, and carrying nightmare dungeons. The build is played as melee because pulls feathers in dealing maximum damage to the enemy closest to the caster. With a lot of mobility from , and has good area of effect clear with pulling enemies in. Go now, and slaughter... the demonic horde. Reviewed by

If the cooldown of is under 5 seconds you can cast it repeatedly. doesn't move you from your current location the animation is much faster. Read up more on Attack Speed in our Bosses are immune to Crowd Control (CC) effects and instead take Stagger Damage when hit by one. The amount of stagger damage dealt depends on the type of CC and is proportional to its duration. After being hit by a CC effect, the Boss will temporarily take less Stagger Damage from a CC of the same type. Effectively, this means that when you're just spamming one type of CC you don't need to spam any more of it than what you need to keep a normal enemy permanently CC-d. To stagger the Boss quickly you need to use as many different types of CC as possible. After the Boss is staggered it gains a certain amount of stacking Stagger Damage Reduction for the rest of the fight: Bosses naturally regain 1% of their Stagger HP every second and when that regen is combined with 90% Stagger Damage Reduction it becomes borderline impossible to Stagger the Boss again unless you bring a serious amount of crowd controls. Soar Gorilla Spiritborn is a fun build great for speed farming, and carrying nightmare dungeons. The build is played as melee because pulls feathers in dealing maximum damage to the enemy closest to the caster. With a lot of mobility from , and has good area of effect clear with pulling enemies in. Go now, and slaughter... the demonic horde. Reviewed by

Read up more on Attack Speed in our Bosses are immune to Crowd Control (CC) effects and instead take Stagger Damage when hit by one. The amount of stagger damage dealt depends on the type of CC and is proportional to its duration. After being hit by a CC effect, the Boss will temporarily take less Stagger Damage from a CC of the same type. Effectively, this means that when you're just spamming one type of CC you don't need to spam any more of it than what you need to keep a normal enemy permanently CC-d. To stagger the Boss quickly you need to use as many different types of CC as possible. After the Boss is staggered it gains a certain amount of stacking Stagger Damage Reduction for the rest of the fight: Bosses naturally regain 1% of their Stagger HP every second and when that regen is combined with 90% Stagger Damage Reduction it becomes borderline impossible to Stagger the Boss again unless you bring a serious amount of crowd controls.
